2.Name: Cibatta, Foc

3.Name: Country Sourdough
notes: 1. Weigh out the water and levain and add it to a large mixing bowl
2. Weigh out the flours and salt and add it on top of the wet ingredients
3. Mix for 6 minutes, until all ingredients are completely incorporated
4. Knead for 10-15 minutes, or until the dough starts to feel tight while kneading
5. Place dough in a greased bowl and cover, leave at room temperature for 60 minutes.
6. Fold dough over itself in a 3-part fold, two times total, once longitudinally and once laterally
7. Wait 30 minutes, then repeat step 6
8. Wait 30 more minutes, then repeat step 6 again.
9. After another 30 minutes, punch dough down and form into a ball by grabbing the edges and folding into the middle until you have a ball with a semi-tight skin

10. Leave to rest for 15-30 minutes, then perform the final shape buy rolling the ball between your hands, trapping a small amount of dough between your hand and the table as you roll. If done correctly, the dough ball will become a firm and tight ball of dough. (Be careful not to overtighten, as the skin will break and the bread will crack as it cooks)
11. Move the dough ball to a flat surface that can be placed in the fridge, and cover with plastic wrap before resting overnight for 8 hours in the refrigerator
12. When ready to bake, place a large pan of water on the bottom rack of the oven and preheat the oven to 445 degrees
13. Make 3 shallow cuts across the top of the dough before placing in the oven. (I recommend a pizza stone, or if you can't find one, a large piece of unglazed slate tile works pretty well)
14. Bake for ~30 minutes, or until the temperature of the bread reaches 190 degrees, replacing the water as needed
15. Continue to bake until bread reaches desired color
16. Enjoy fresh or cool completely before storing
